linkTarget.anchoringText: The Komsomolskoye oil field is located in a remote location of Western Kazakhstan (Figure 1) onshore on the Buzachi Peninsula, some 350 km from the regional city of Aktau and 110 km from the nearest village Kyzan (Figure 2).

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Map of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Location of the Komsomolskoye field

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of the Republic of Kazakhstan. Location of the Komsomolskoye field

linkTarget.anchoringText: The Komsomolskoye oil field is located in a remote location of Western Kazakhstan (Figure 1) onshore on the Buzachi Peninsula, some 350 km from the regional city of Aktau and 110 km from the nearest village Kyzan (Figure 2).

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Mangystau region of the Western part of Kazakhstan. The Komsomolskoye field location

formatted-caption.caption-text: Mangystau region of the Western part of Kazakhstan. The Komsomolskoye field location

linkTarget.anchoringText: Furthermore, the field’s remote location required significant additional investments to connect it to the export pipeline and road system. Therefore, in 1987 the seven dry wells were abandoned and the remaining 10 wells were suspended, or ʺconservedʺ. The conservation period lasted from 1987-2003 and ended with re-entry and re-activation of these wells as part of the existing Komsomolskoye development. See Figures 3 and 4.

Furthermore, the field’s remote location required significant additional investments to connect it to the export pipeline and road system. Therefore, in 1987 the seven dry wells were abandoned and the remaining 10 wells were suspended, or ʺconservedʺ. The conservation period lasted from 1987-2003 and ended with re-entry and re-activation of these wells as part of the existing Komsomolskoye development. See Figures 3 and 4.
See also Figure 5. This hybrid well pattern has been proven as a robust concept for a number of reasons.

image-wrap.label: Figure 6
image-wrap.caption: Main surface facilities layout: Roads, electrical lines, water injection lines. Only selected wells shown on map.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Main surface facilities layout: Roads, electrical lines, water injection lines. Only selected wells shown on map.

image-wrap.label: Figure 9
image-wrap.caption: Declining trend in reservoir pressure has been arrested above bubble point (for now), due to water injection, gas injection and natural aquifer.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Declining trend in reservoir pressure has been arrested above bubble point (for now), due to water injection, gas injection and natural aquifer.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The main area to the South from the principal faults also allows picking of up to three additional well locations (Figure 10). Before committing to additional wells, every effort should be undertaken to increase water injection up to or above voidage replacement ratio.

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: Potential infilldrilling locations for optimization of areal sweep efficiency

formatted-caption.caption-text: Potential infilldrilling locations for optimization of areal sweep efficiency
